About
About
Hello, I am Roberto!
With a track record as a passionate and influential minded professional, I possess expertise in leading sustainability, ESG, and climate change initiatives, while assessing and measuring decarbonization opportunities.
I have expansive expertise in leading sustainability integration within core business operations, ensuring alignment with ESG objectives, and driving meaningful change throughout the value chain.
Collaboration is at the heart of my approach, and I excel at fostering robust partnerships for collective action and create shared value. By leveraging my expertise, I strive to create sustainable business that generate long-term profitability while preserving climate change and risk management. 
My technical skills are Stella Architect, Microsoft Project, GIS, ATLAS TI, Real-time landscaping Architecture, AutoCAD, Microsoft Office Suite
Poised for the next level of career success my greatest value to any organization is my ability to work independently, freeing up a leader's time to focus on the needs of the business.
To find out more, please connect with me or send me an email at rcfortet@gmail.com. 
Following are my key skills:
• Climate Risk Strategy
• Sustainability Programs
• Environment/Social Impact Analysis 
• ESG & Risk Reporting
• Change Management Plans
• ESG Regulations/Legislation Compliance
• Environment & Sustainability Practices
• Business Solutions & Decisions
• Teamwork & Leadership

Durante la semana del 6 de octubre de 2025, el Centro de Innovación, Investigación y Tecnología Hidroambiental (CITEC) dio inicio al proceso participativo del proyecto “Desarrollo participativo de un modelo socioeconómico para el análisis de la escasez hídrica en la Cuenca Hidrográfica del Canal de Panamá”.

Este proceso comenzó tras un riguroso análisis de actores clave, en el que se identificaron roles como tomadores de decisiones, usuarios e implementadores, evaluando además sus atributos de poder, legitimidad y urgencia. Este paso permitió establecer un marco inclusivo y representativo de las diversas dinámicas sociales que influyen en la gestión del agua.

Ya se encuentran en marcha las entrevistas individuales en campo, lideradas por el Dr. Roberto Forte Ph.D. , Director Ejecutivo de CITEC, y la Mgtr. Alessandra Torrente, con el apoyo de Dabney Gerald Sánchez Ramos, representante del PNUD Panamá, y Gloria Trejos por el Canal de Panamá. A través de estas sesiones se están elaborando diagramas causales de bucle (CLD) junto a los participantes, identificando causas e impactos de primer, segundo y tercer orden, así como las relaciones de retroalimentación que explican las dinámicas de escasez hídrica en la región.

Este esfuerzo colaborativo tiene como objetivo codiseñar un modelo participativo que integre conocimiento local y enfoques sistémicos, contribuyendo al análisis de escenarios y a la toma de decisiones informadas en políticas públicas relacionadas con la gestión hídrica.
CITEC reafirma su compromiso con la ciencia aplicada, la participación ciudadana y la sostenibilidad de los recursos hídricos del país.

Organize and conduct research related to small- and large-scale regenerative agriculture systems, as well as climate change adaptation. 
Collaborates with McGill University's Ecological Engineering Laboratory on proposals for research funding.

Development of three scientific publications covering the following topics:

1) Systematic Literature Review of Permaculture as a concept.

2) Incorporating system dynamic modeling and stakeholder analysis into participatory stakeholder processes.

3) Comparing the sustainability of small-scale farming systems through the integration of process models and system dynamics models.

During this time period, I developed 55 ha mixed rotational grazing system in Penonome, Panama according to permaculture, organic agriculture, renewable energy, and ecological principles. I was engaged in creating agro-ecological system for Mariato, Panama aimed at cultivation of 5 ha site depending on bio-intensive and permaculture principles within Punta Chame, Panama. Another contribution of mine was as Teaching Assistant for sustained tropical agriculture course during 2020, 2022, and 2023.
My key attainments in this role were as follow: 
• Ensured effective engagement in McGill-Dalhousie Agricultural Greenhouse Gases Project as well as Climate Awareness and Action Project.
• Devised technique for critical components' representation of small farming system and assisted stakeholders in comprehending agricultural system complexities, resulting in obtaining insights and supporting tropical regions with sustainable/progressive agricultural systems adoption.
• Attained USD 300,000.00+ bank loan for state-of-the-art rotational grazing operation on Panama 55 ha via tactical business plan development.

I was Founder of international forum on sustainable cities, garnering 1000+ participants from 12 countries and 75+ firms within four years' tenure. I led LEED technical meetings for Latin America region and arranged workshops for coaching 300+ LEED experts, while attracting 15+ interns from local/global universities in Germany and Mexico. I established events/seminars portfolio with 40+ activities on yearly basis via PGBC's Education Committee leadership. I played key role in public consultation of National Energy Plan Vision 2015 - 2050.
Here were my significant contributions to this role: 
• Secured $500 annually in energy bills and raised $25,000+ assets by executing "Make Us Greener Project", developing sustainable office case study based on PGBC offices and funded by member's products/systems.
• Led 35% increase in corporate memberships and fostered sustainability across national/central American level.
• Minimized staff turnover and generated positive, inclusive workplace.
• Created PGBC's Business Plan in 2016 - 2018, earning established status in World Green Building Council and accelerating PGBC's income.

I have had the pleasure of having Roberto as my student in the ESG Reporting Masterclass this year. I was impressed by the strategic questions that Roberto asked during the session, as it clearly shows the background knowledge he has, as well as curiosity, together with the right mindset to learn the technicalities of the various ESG topics to be able to apply them practically.
He has shown that he has the appetite to learn by taking other courses like ESG Risk Management and the prep course for Fundamentals in Sustainability Accounting credential through Earth Academy. In all his engagements, he has always been a keen learner with a positive attitude and mindset for learning. In this dynamic time, Roberto has made sure to stay up to date with the recent developments and technicalities. He would be an asset to any project or organization with his knowledge and skills.
